criteria: Identification of strategies to increase daily physical activity.
Application of strategies to personal life.
descriptions: Student demonstrates no understanding of physical activity recommendations.
Student shows limited awareness of physical activity recommendations, unable to identify specific guidelines.
Student identifies general physical activity recommendations but lacks detail or accuracy.
Student accurately describes physical activity recommendations, including frequency and duration.
Student demonstrates a strong understanding of physical activity recommendations, including different types of activities and their benefits.
Student comprehensively understands physical activity recommendations and can tailor them to individual needs and circumstances.
Student cannot identify any strategies to increase daily physical activity.
Student suggests one or two vague strategies to increase physical activity.
Student identifies a few basic strategies to increase daily physical activity, such as walking or taking the stairs.
Student identifies several concrete strategies to increase daily physical activity, considering different contexts (e.g., school, home, community).
Student identifies a wide range of effective strategies to increase daily physical activity, demonstrating creativity and resourcefulness.
Student identifies and analyzes a comprehensive set of strategies to increase daily physical activity, considering personal preferences, environmental factors, and potential barriers.
Student does not attempt to apply strategies to their personal life.
Student mentions a vague desire to increase physical activity but does not suggest any specific changes.
Student suggests one or two simple changes to increase their personal physical activity but lacks a clear plan.
Student develops a realistic plan to incorporate several strategies into their daily routine, considering potential challenges.
Student creates a detailed and personalized plan to increase daily physical activity, outlining specific goals, timelines, and strategies for overcoming obstacles.
Student not only creates a comprehensive plan but also reflects on its potential impact and identifies strategies for long-term adherence.
